origination.corpname: [Sheet music of University of Michigan songs and music]

did.unittitle: Sheet music of University of Michigan songs and music 1894-1947
did.abstract: Loose sheet music of University of Michigan songs and music including marches, sports songs and cheers, instrumental works, and various arrangements of "The Yellow and Blue" and "The Victor's."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Collection acquired from a number of different sources and assembled by Bentley staff.

accruals.p: No additional titles are expected, though new or better copies of existing title may be acquired.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright status of individual titles varies. It may be in public domain or it may remain with the publishers or their heirs or successors.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Sheet music of University of Michigan songs and music, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The collection acquired from a number of different sources and assembled by Bentley staff.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of loose sheet music of University of Michigan songs and music including marches, sports songs and cheers, instrumental works, and various arrangements of "The Yellow and Blue" and "The Victor's." The collection is arranged by song title.

did.unittitle: Sheet music of Michigan songs and music
Bluebook Blues. Words by A. L. Weeks. Music by A. J. Gornetzky. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment, 1918
Cheer, Cheer, Cheer for Michigan. Words and music by Lee Tann, 1947
College Days: "Koanzaland." Words by Donald A. Kahn. Music by Earl V. Moore. Unison vocal with piano accompaniment, four part vocal chorus, 1912
Dear Old Michigan. Words by C. Arthur Blass. Music by Julius Wuerthner. Published by Brehm Bros., Erie Pa., 1910
Fight Men of Michigan: March and Two Step. Words and music by William C. Archi. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment, 1915
Fighting S.A.T.C. Words by Oscar A. Adel and A. J. Levin. Music by A. J. Gornetzky. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment, 1918
Hail Michigan. Words and music by Claudius G. Pendill. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment, chord symbols for guitar, ukulele, banjo, or accordion; chart for guitar, 1941. 4 copies (signed)
Hail Michigan. Music by Rowland W. Fixel. Words by Sylvan S. Grosner. Published by University Music House, Ann Arbor, Mich., 1912
I'm a Goin' to Go to Ypsilanti. Words by C. Arthur Blass. Music by Julius Wuerthner. Published by Brehm Bros., Erie, Pa., 1910
Jingles: A College March and Two-Step. Composed by M. B. Cooper. Arranged by Harry Turner. Piano, 1906
Laudes Atque Carmina. Arranged by Florence Shirley
Men of Michigan. Words by Bob Elbel. Music by Bob Elbel -- Wm. Revelli. Original Manuscript ed., 1936
Men of Yost: Football March-Two-Step. Composed by M. B. Cooper. Arranged by Harry Turner. Piano, 1904
Men of Yost: Michigan's Football Song. Composed by M. B. Cooper. Arranged by E. R. Schremser. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment, 1905
Michigan: March and Two Step. Martha Dickinson Taylor. (With words of The Yellow and Blue by Charles M. Gayley.) Piano, vocal, 1902
The Michigan Field Song. Words by Lyman Bryson. Music by Roy Dickinson Welch. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment, 1910.
Michigan Forever: A March Song. Words by S. N. Lagatree. Music by W. N. Moffett. Vocal with piano accompaniment, 1906
Michigan, Goodbye. [Words by] Donald A. Kahn, J. Fred Lawton. [Music by] Earl V. Moore. [Published by] University of Michigan Union Opera, 1909
Michigan Memories. By John W. Stout. Commissioned by Dr. and Mrs. Fleming A. Barbour. Arrangement for orchestra, circa 1982
Michigan's Men of Steel. Words and music by Roy Dickinson Welch. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment, 1913
Next to the Grand Old Flag Comes the Yellow and Blue. By Walker M. Lang. Published by Jerome H. Remick & Co., Detroit and New York, 1910
O Alma Mater: Michigan University Song. By Roy Dickinson Welch. Four part vocal with piano accompaniment, 1908
Stadium March : A Michigan Marching Song. Words by Allis F. Hussey. Music by Carl E. Gehring. Vocal with piano accompaniment, trumpet fanfare, 1926
That Michigan Band. By C. D. Kountz and Harry Turner. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment 1914
'Tis of Michigan We Sing. Author of first stanza unknown. Second and third stanzas and chorus by Edmund S. C. May. Music adapted from "Lizette."
U of M Waltz. By Lew H. Clement. Piano arrangement for dancing, 1894
Varsity.
Music by Earl V. Moore. Arranged for orchestra by S. Deshon 1911
Music by Earl V. Moore. Arranged for [Michigan Marching band] by Tom Clark
Words by Fred J. Lawton. Music by Earl V. Moore. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment 1911
Varsity Days: Introducing the Michigan Drinking Song. By C. M. Foss. Arranged for piano, 1903
Varsity March. Arranged by Roscoe M. Gage. Arrangements for guitar, first mandolin, second mandolin, undated
The Victors: March. By Louis Elbel.
Arranged for piano 1899
Arranged for mandolin, guitar 1899
Win for Michigan: A Field Song. By William T. Whedon. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment, 1913
The Yellow and Blue. Words by Charles M. Gayley. Music by Balfe.
Arranged by Earl Killeen. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment; four part vocal 1908
Vocal solo with piano accompaniment 1928
The Yellow and Blue: Two Step. By Leon M. Jones. Vocal solo with piano accompaniment, 1895
